articles.title: UFT blasts Mayor Adams as ‘hostage’ to Trump’s DOJ, says students ‘paying the price’
articles.description: New York City’s powerful teachers union on Wednesday accused Mayor Adams of being “hostage” to the Trump administration over the expected dismissal of the mayor’s corruption case — while local schools and their students pay the price.In an open letter, United Federation of Teachers President Michael Mulgrew said Adams has created a climate of fear […]
articles.content:
New York City’s powerful teachers union on Wednesday accused Mayor Adams of being “hostage” to the Trump administration over the expected dismissal of the mayor’s corruption case — while local schools and their students pay the price.

articles.title: Judge Lets Trump's Buyouts of Federal Workers Proceed
articles.description: A federal judge removed the hold he'd placed on President Trump's buyouts of federal workers on Wednesday, ruling that neither he nor the unions that sued to block it...
articles.content: A federal judge removed the hold he'd placed on President Trump's buyouts of federal workers on Wednesday, ruling that neither he nor the unions that sued to block it can stop the plan. US District Judge George O'Toole had paused the buyouts on Thurs... [1070 chars]

articles.title: X will pay ‘about $10 million’ to settle lawsuit over Donald Trump’s Twitter suspension
articles.description: X has become the latest social media platform to reach a settlement with Donald Trump in a years-long legal battle over his 2021 social media suspenions.
articles.content: X has reached a settlement with President Donald Trump in a lawsuit over the president’s 2021 suspension from Twitter. The Wall Street Journal reports that the Elon Musk-owned company has agreed to pay “about $10 million” to settle the long-running c... [1107 chars]

articles.author: New York Daily News
articles.title: Trump elected Kennedy Center chairman as longtime president is ousted
articles.description: The president is making good on his promise to combat what he calls “woke” and “terrible”  programming at the prestigious cultural center in Washington, D.C.
articles.content:
Donald Trump has been elected chairman of the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts as the organization’s longtime president, Deborah F. Rutter, has reportedly been fired.
The U.S. president is making good on his promise to combat what he calls “wok... [2336 chars]

articles.title: GOP hardliners threaten revolt over Johnson plan to implement Trump agenda
articles.description: Speaker Mike Johnson’s budget plan is in trouble as multiple GOP hardliners seek last-minute changes that could risk support from the party’s centrist middle — jeopardizing leadership’s plans to kickstart President Donald Trump’s agenda in Congress.

articles.author: Washington Examiner
articles.title: Republicans war against the courts for thwarting Trump's agenda
articles.description: "These judges are acting as judicial activists rather than honest arbiters of the law," White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said.
articles.content:
Democrats have railed against the conservative-dominated Supreme Court for nearly a decade but are now cheering on federal judges ruling against the Trump administration while Republicans fume.
